div.p: I hope this finds you well and that you and your families are staying safe and healthy. Virtual learning has continued for many of our students, and we are so proud of our teachers and students who are connecting together through virtual conferencing video technology. The video conferences are a way to help with academic information/support, but also the social and emotional well-being of students.

Registration for Preschool and Kindergarten for 2020-2021 School Year

p.b: The Lisbon Exempted Village School District is registering preschool and kindergarten students for the 2020-2021 school year. Starting May 4, 2020, the Lisbon Board of Education Office will be open from 8-12 p.m., Monday-Friday for preschool and kindergarten registration for the 2020-2021 school year. Please call (330-424-7714) to schedule an appointment and to pick up your packet. The Board Office is located at 317 N. Market Street, Lisbon, Ohio. You can also start the enrollment process online.

img.alt: DAHS senior with her Class of 2020 Yard Sign

span.p: The Lisbon Board of Education delivered yard signs to the Class of 2020.
Seniors also wore their "Friends" inspired senior t-shirts.

a.title: Click to read more about: Saluting the Class of 2020

div.a: Read More about Saluting the Class of 2020

span.p: From the Desk of Nurse Haren:

Please make sure you are getting your information about the COVID-19 virus from a reliable source! The Lisbon community should have access to the Ohio Department of Health Website. You can research our situation starting there. I hope you are all staying safe! Keep washing those hands!

div.a: Car Parade to Wave Hello to Students

img.alt: Cars lined up at DAHS for the Car Parade

span.p: Teachers and staff from the Lisbon Exempted Village School District have certainly missed seeing students. On Friday, April 10, they did a car parade for students. 71 vehicles were part of the lineup. Thank you to everyone who took part, and our students and families for braving the cold to give a wave back to their teachers. A special thank you to Lisbon Police and Fire Departments for helping and being part of the parade!

a.title: Click to read more about: Car Parade to Wave Hello to Students

div.a: Read More about Car Parade to Wave Hello to Students

span.p:
Just a reminder, DAHS students have the opportunity to video conference everyday. Students, be sure to check your school email. Here’s the schedule for future video conferences.
1st period - 9:00 am
2nd period - 9:40 am
3rd period - 10:20 am
4th period - 11:00 am
5th period - 12:30 pm
6th period - 1:10 pm
7th period - 1:50 pm
8th period - 2:30 pm

Wednesday and Friday 12-4
